intro: Taraxacum koraginense, commonly known as the Koragin dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. This plant is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a yellow composite flower head that blooms in the summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
